entry.et: Middle English, dispute, guilt, purpose, from Old English sacu guilt, action at law; akin to Old High German sahha action at law, cause, Old English sēcan to seek seek

def.dt: :end purpose for the sake of argument
:the good, advantage, or enhancement of some entity (as an ideal) free to pursue learning for its own sake M. S. Eisenhower
:personal or social welfare, safety, or benefit
:a Japanese alcoholic beverage of fermented rice often served hot
